level.text: The purpose of this chapter is to establish uniform requirements for transferring money or other things of value to recipients outside the District government, where the Agency is authorized to make grants.
The Director of the Child and Family Services Agency, or his or her designee, is authorized to make a grant where:
A statute authorizes the Agency to support or stimulate the activity of the recipient;
The Agency will not be substantially involved in the activity so supported or stimulated; and
The Agency is not acquiring any property or service of direct use to the District government.
The Agency is authorized to make grants pursuant to the D.C. Code ยง4-1303.3 the Child and Family Services Establishment Act.
Copies of this chapter shall be available from CFSA upon request.
